citation.name: Neurology
citation.title: Selenoprotein biosynthesis defect causes progressive encephalopathy with elevated lactate.

comment.text: Converts O-phosphoseryl-tRNA(Sec) to selenocysteinyl-tRNA(Sec) required for selenoprotein biosynthesis.
Aminoacyl-tRNA biosynthesis; selenocysteinyl-tRNA(Sec) biosynthesis; selenocysteinyl-tRNA(Sec) from L-seryl-tRNA(Sec) (archaeal/eukaryal route): step 2/2.

Homotetramer formed by a catalytic dimer and a non-catalytic dimer serving as a binding platform that orients tRNASec for catalysis. Each tetramer binds the CCA ends of two tRNAs which point to the active sites of the catalytic dimer.
Primarily expressed in liver, pancreas, kidney and lung. Overexpressed in PHA-stimulated T-cells.

disease.name: Pontocerebellar hypoplasia 2D
disease.description: A disorder characterized by postnatal onset of progressive atrophy of the cerebrum and cerebellum, microcephaly, profound mental retardation, spasticity, and variable seizures.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Possible diagnostic marker for autoimmune hepatitis (AIH).
May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

property.value: Expressed in right lobe of liver and 167 other tissues

feature.description: May act as a substrate filter by repelling compounds with a negatively charged alpha-carboxylate
In PCH2D; abrogates enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs267607035.
In PCH2D; abrogates enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs267607036.
